cards.name: Blaine's Last Resort
text: You can't play this card if you have any cards in your hand other than Blaine's Last Resort. Show your hand to your opponent, then draw 5 cards.

cards.name: Erika's Perfume
text: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Basic Pokémon cards there, you may put any number of them onto your opponent's Bench (as long as there's room).

cards.name: Brock's Training Method
text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card with Brock in its name. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Celadon City Gym
text: During each player's turn, that player may choose to discard an Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Pokémon with Erika in its name. If that player does so, that Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed or Poisoned.

cards.name: Cerulean City Gym
text: Each player pays 1 less to retreat his or her Pokémon if it has Misty in its name.

cards.name: Erika's Maids
text: Trade 2 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards with Erika in their names from your deck. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Repeating Drill
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Knockout Needle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 60 more damage. If 1 or both of them are tails, this attack does 30 damage.

cards.name: Brock
text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Erika
text: You may draw up to 3 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 3 cards.

cards.name: Lt. Surge
text: You can play this card only if you have at least 1 Basic Pokémon card in your hand. Put a Basic Pokémon card from your hand into play as your Active Pokémon. Put your old Active Pokémon onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.)

cards.name: Misty
text: Discard 2 of the other cards in your hand in order to play this card. If this turn's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and if the attacking Pokémon has Misty in its name, the attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: The Rocket's Trap
text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose up to 3 cards at random from your opponent's hand (don't look at them). Your opponent shuffles those cards into his or her deck.

ability.name: Fragrance Trap
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Erika's Victreebel is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.name: Sabrina's Gaze
text: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of the same number of cards.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. If a Pokémon has fewer damage counters than the number of heads, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Sonic Distortion
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 or both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Rock Toss
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

ability.name: Photosynthesis
ability.text: All Energy cards attached to Erika's Oddish provide Grass Energy instead of their usual type. This power works even while Erika's Oddish is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Flytrap
attacks.text: Before doing damage, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon with Misty in its name and put it onto your Bench. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each W Energy attached to Misty's Starmie but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Crystal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Blaze
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on your opponent's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Blaine's Ponyta.

ability.name: Natural Healing
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from Blaine's Vulpix. This power can't be used if Blaine's Vulpix is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Fan
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Trash Exchange
text: Count the number of cards in your discard pile and shuffle them into your deck. Then discard that many cards from the top of your deck.

attacks.name: Drill Tackle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 or both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Brock's Sandshrew during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Return a Energy card attached to Sabrina's Abra to your hand in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: No Removal Gym
text: A player must discard 2 cards from his or her hand in order to play an Energy Removal or Super Energy Removal card.

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

cards.name: The Rocket's Training Gym
text: Each player pays 1 more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Blaine's Quiz #1
text: Put a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent its name. Your opponent guesses the length of that Pokémon. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 2 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 2 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.

cards.name: Brock
text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Erika
text: You may draw up to 3 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 3 cards.

cards.name: Lt. Surge
text: You can play this card only if you have at least 1 Basic Pokémon card in your hand. Put a Basic Pokémon card from your hand into play as your Active Pokémon. Put your old Active Pokémon onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.)

cards.name: Pewter City Gym
text: Don't apply Resistance to any attacks made by Pokémon with Brock in their names.

cards.name: Secret Mission
text: Look at your opponent's hand. Then, you may discard as many other cards as you want from your hand and draw that many cards.

cards.name: Vermilion City Gym
text: Whenever a player attacks with a Pokémon with Lt. Surge in its name, he or she may flip a coin. If heads, and if that Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, the attacking Pokémon does 10 damage to itself in addition to whatever its attack usually does.

cards.name: Blaine's Gamble
text: Discard any number of other cards from your hand, then flip a coin. If heads, draw twice that many cards.

cards.name: Energy Flow
text: For each of your Pokémon, you may return any number of Energy cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Narrow Gym
text: No player may have more than 4 Pokémon on his or her Bench. When this card is played, if a player has 5 Pokémon on his or her Bench, that player chooses 1 of them and returns it and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. (If both players have to return a Pokémon, your opponent returns a Pokémon first.)

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Take Away
attacks.text: Shuffle Erika's Dragonair and all cards attached to it into your deck. Then, your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attach to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz in order to use this attack. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Energy Charge
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), if Lt. Surge's Magneton is your Active Pokémon, you may take 1 Lightning Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to Lt. Surge's Magneton. This power can't be used if Lt. Surge's Magneton is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Magneton does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Crosscounter
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Hitmonchan is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Rocket's Hitmonchan attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for double that amount of damage. (If Rocket's Hitmonchan takes 20 damage, it does 40 damage to that Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that already has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Call of the Night
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Horn Toss
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Brock's Rhyhorn does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Alert
attacks.text: Draw a card. Then, switch Brock's Zubat with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. You can't use this attack if your Bench is empty.

attacks.name: Moonwatching
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Comet Slap
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz

attacks.name: Electric Current
attacks.text: Take 1 Energy card attached to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard that Energy card.

attacks.name: Mysterious Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Pod
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Pokémon named Tentacool, Tentacruel, Misty's Tentacool, or Misty's Tentacruel. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Lucky Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiral Dive
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psychic Exchange
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

attacks.name: Dream Dance
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Asleep (after dealing damage).

attacks.name: Vile Smell
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Rapids
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Misty's Poliwhirl. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Good Night
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Good Morning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon was Asleep, it is no longer Asleep.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Blaine's Charmander in order to use this attack. If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

attacks.name: Bellow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Vine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: If there are any damage counters on Erika's Oddish, remove 1 of them.

attacks.name: Sporadic Sponging
attacks.text: If Erika's Oddish has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 of those damage counters.

attacks.name: Stretch Vine
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Stare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Suggestion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lazy Attack
attacks.text: Sabrina's Slowpoke is now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Poison Antennae
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Removal Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

cards.name: Misty's Wrath
text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose 2 of those cards and put them into your hand. Discard the rest.

cards.name: Sabrina's ESP
text: Attach Sabrina's ESP to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name. At the end of your turn, discard Sabrina's ESP. If that Pokémon uses an attack that involves flipping coins, Sabrina's ESP lets you re-flip those coins once. If you do, re-flip all the coins.

cards.name: Charity
text: Attach Charity to your Active Pokémon. Unless that Pokémon gets Knocked Out, return Charity to your hand at the end of your turn. If that Pokémon attacks and does damage to the Defending Pokémon, you may reduce that damage by any amount (rounded to the nearest 10).

cards.name: Misty
text: Discard 2 of the other cards in your hand in order to play this card. If this turn's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and if the attacking Pokémon has Misty in its name, the attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Good Manners
text: In order to play this card, you can't have any Basic Pokémon cards in your hand. Show your hand to your opponent, then search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Lt. Surge's Treaty
text: Your opponent chooses 1 of the following: everyone chooses 1 of his or her own Prizes and puts it into his or her hand, or you draw a card.

ability.name: Pollen Defense
ability.text: If an attack does damage to Erika's Vileplume while it's your Active Pokémon (even if it's Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. This power works even while Erika's Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: If Erika's Vileplume does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove a number of damage counters from Erika's Vileplume equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Erika's Vileplume has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

ability.name: Flee
ability.text: If an attack does damage to Misty's Tentacruel while it's your Active Pokémon, you may switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, which prevents all other effects of that attack on Misty's Tentacruel. This power can't be used if Misty's Tentacruel is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fire Wall
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Moltres during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Moltres is Knocked Out), Rocket's Moltres attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for 10 damage. (Apply Weakness and Resistance.)

attacks.name: Needles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sandstorm
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

ability.name: Shell Armor
ability.text: You may reduce all damage done by attacks to Misty's Cloyster by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power can't be used if Misty's Cloyster is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Triple Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Child's Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: One-Two Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Lava Burst
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. (If there are fewer than 5 cards in your deck, discard all of them.) This attack does 20 damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from Erika's Gloom. If Erika's Gloom has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Magic Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned (your choice).

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

attacks.name: Mud Splash
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Night Spirits
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the total number of Sabrina's Gastlys, Sabrina's Haunters, and Sabrina's Gengars you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
